poem:
### The Alchemy of Dinner

The chicken, crowned in paprika's red cloak,  
rests with the ease of a Sunday afternoon.  
Gold kernels and spiced steam rise  
to perform their kitchen ballet,  
each grain of couscous a silent note.  
And there you are,  
a quiet alchemist in the clatter,  
transforming ingredients into  
this evening's magic.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Moroccan chicken with spiced couscous from Clodagh McKenna – video This impressive-looking dish from Irish chef, columnist and TV presenter Clodagh McKenna is surprisingly easy to pull together, making it perfect for an indulgent midweek meal or stress-free Sunday dinner. Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
